title: The extraordinary mystery of the Tigers' Tarik Skubal
content: 'I wasn't good until I was 26,' the All-Star pitcher says. How he rose from Little League lore to Cy Young.

title: OKC's Holmgren agrees to rookie max extension
content: Thunder star Chet Holmgren has agreed to a fully guaranteed five-year million maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $250 million, Bill Duffy of WME Basketball told ESPN on Wednesday morning.

title: Bailey's inside-the-park, walk-off HR 1st since '16
content: Patrick Bailey hit a three-run, inside-the-park home run with one out in the ninth inning, lifting the Giants over the Phillies on Tuesday night.

title: Clark, Collier draft All-Star teams, flip coaches
content: Caitlin Clark selected her two Indiana All-Star teammates in the draft to determine teams for the WNBA All-Star Game on July 19.

title: Ohtani takes Miz deep but phenom fans 12 in win
content: Shohei Ohtani greeted Jacob Misiorowski with a 431-foot leadoff homer Tuesday night, but the Milwaukee Brewers rookie phenom got the last laugh with a 12-strikeout night.

title: Mets' Mendoza: Snubbed Soto 'an All-Star for us'
content: The New York Mets consider Juan Soto an All-Star, despite the snub he received from those who selected the National League squad, but manager Carlos Mendoza told reporters Tuesday, "I'm hoping in the next couple of days we hear something and he makes it."

title: Horner sacked as Red Bull chief, team confirms
content: Christian Horner has been sacked by Red Bull after 20 years as team principal, the team confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Sources: Jokic to delay extension talks until '26
content: Nikola Jokic will not seek a contract extension this summer, delaying extension talks until next summer, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ayton: Joining Doncic 'feels like a video game'
content: More than seven years after being drafted ahead of Luka Doncic, 2018 No. 1 pick Deandre Ayton was amazed Tuesday when considering the chance to team up with the superstar on the Los Angeles Lakers, telling reporters "this feels like a video game."

title: Two A's and how many F's?! Midseason grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: From the contenders acing 2025 to the first-half failures, we take a look at every club's performance.

title: Trade proposals for Paul Skenes, Ronald Acuña Jr., Byron Buxton
content: You won't see these stars available via trade this year -- but what would it take to land them if they were?

title: Who are the NFL's best edge rushers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best edge rushers in the NFL? Execs, coaches and scouts ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: Assembling the 2028 Olympic roster for U.S. flag football: Our 10-player roster -- and one go-to play
content: We picked nine NFL players -- and one college football star -- for the U.S. Olympic flag football roster for 2028. Who would make our team?

title: Wetzel: All of college football ought to cheer for Texas Tech
content: The Red Raiders' signing of Felix Ojo shows the college football playing field is continuing to level.

title: New East tiers: How injuries, offseason movement reshaped the conference
content: From injured superstars to play-in teams making major splashes, Chris Herring runs down every team's outlook for 2025-26.

title: Power Rankings: Storm up, Aces down and no time to panic for New York
content: The defending champ opened the season with nine straight wins. But it has lost six of the past nine games.

title: Inside the shift in evaluating MLB draft catching prospects
content: MLB's 2023 rules changes are influencing how the position is taught, played, coached, scouted at all levels.

title: Ranking all 32 NFL teams based on WR, RB and TE talent: Who's No. 1? Who's No. 32?
content: Which teams have the best skill position talent around their quarterback? We stacked all 32 from worst to first.

title: Can rising American Taylor Fritz topple Carlos Alcaraz?
content: It's a tall order to say the least, but Fritz has a chance to be the first American man to make the Wimbledon final since 2009.

title: Why Mbappé, PSG reunion at Club World Cup will be must-see TV
content: Kylian Mbappé will meet his former club, PSG, on Wednesday in the Club World Cup semifinal. It'll be a fascinating reunion for many reasons, not least because of how PSG have grown without him.

title: USMNT built foundation of pride, aggression at Gold Cup
content: Spanish soccer expert Graham Hunter followed the USMNT at the Gold Cup, and he saw the foundations being laid for Mauricio Pochettino's vision.

title: Gyökeres: Amorim's tactics 'suited me perfectly'
content: Sporting CP forward Viktor Gyökeres has said the style of play under his former coach Ruben Amorim "suited me perfectly."

title: Teams can 'win' home advantage in UCL
content: UEFA's decision means teams that finish between third and sixth in the league phase cannot get home priority in the Champions League semifinals.

title: MPs approve Premier League, EFL regulator
content: MPs voted in favour of establishing a professional football regulator under a "Football Governance Bill" that would see clubs handed operating licences.

title: Caicedo suffers late ankle injury in Chelsea win
content: Chelsea midfielder Moisés Caicedo hurt his left ankle during second-half injury time in Tuesday's 2-0 win over Fluminense in the semifinals of the Club World Cup.

title: Chelsea's Pedro 'sorry' to knock out boyhood club
content: João Pedro kept the celebrations to a minimum after scoring twice to send Chelsea into the Club World Cup final, his goals proving the undoing of his former club Fluminense in a bittersweet meeting at MetLife Stadium on Tuesday.

title: Luis Enrique on Mbappé: Not discussing the 'past'
content: PSG coach Luis Enrique refused to discuss Kylian Mbappé ahead of Wednesday's Club World Cup semifinal with his former star's new club Real Madrid.

title: Police: Speeding could be factor in Jota crash
content: Spanish police believe Liverpool player Diogo Jota was driving over the speed limit when he and his brother died in a car crash last week.

title: United confirm Cunha as new No. 10 after Rashford
content: New Manchester United signing Matheus Cunha will wear the No. 10 shirt previously worn by Marcus Rashford, the Premier League club confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Germany beat Denmark despite early wobbles
content: Germany had to come from behind to beat Denmark, but the win puts them into the quarterfinals. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: Texas Tech's tortillas and more updates to CFB 26 are shown through team accounts
content: New traditions, presentation features and uniforms have been added to the second edition of the college football game since its return from hiatus.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander named NBA 2K26 cover athlete
content: SGA adds another accolade to a summer that already includes an MVP, a title, and a $285 million extension.

title: Midyear boxing awards: Best KO and fighter, top fight, biggest disappointment and more
content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on what boxing has delivered thus far this year -- good and bad.﻿

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Spurs in four-way battle for Dibling
content: Manchester United are in a four-way battle to sign Southampton's Tyler Dibling. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Rishabh Pant reveals the secret behind his stump mic antics
content: The 27-year-old Rishabh Pant, who recently made a buzz with his appearance at Wimbledon, also shared insights on India’s playing XI, how the team overcame the absence of premier pacer Jasprit Bumrah in the second Test, and the strong on-field communication between himself and captain Shubman Gill.

title: Zohran Mamdani called 'Islamist': 100+ startup founders write open letter; 'We cannot...'
content: An open letter signed by numerous startup founders and tech workers demands Sequoia Capital take action against partner Shaun Maguire for his Islamophobic remarks against NYC mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani. Maguire's comments sparked outrage, leading to calls for a public apology, investigation, and hate speech policies. Instead of apologizing, Maguire has doubled down, further escalating the controversy with divisive rhetoric.

title: 'Vedas and Upnishads': Amit Shah shares his post-retirement plans
content: Union home minister Amit Shah revealed his post-retirement plans, focusing on studying Hindu scriptures like the Vedas and Upanishads. He also intends to dedicate his time to natural farming, highlighting its health benefits and ability to boost agricultural productivity. Shah shared his personal experience of increased yields through natural farming methods.

title: Sena MLA slap row: Uddhav claims 'conspiracy' to defame CM Fadnavis
content: Uddhav Thackeray claims a conspiracy exists to defame Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis. This follows an incident where Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad slapped a canteen worker. Gaikwad complained about stale food at the MLAs' hostel in Mumbai. Fadnavis criticized the MLA's actions. Eknath Shinde stated he does not support violence.

title: ‘Laughed at how stupid it was’: Epstein’s brother mocks FBI suicide ruling
content: Mark Epstein has refuted the FBI and DOJ's conclusion that his brother, Jeffrey Epstein, committed suicide, dismissing their findings as "stupid" and indicative of a potential murder. He criticized Kash Patel's assertion of suicide, questioning his expertise. Mark Epstein also highlighted discrepancies in autopsy reports and the unavailability of surveillance footage, further fueling his suspicion of foul play.

title: Elon Musk reacts as Bill Gates again raises alarm on USAID funding cut killing children
content: Bill Gates expressed concerns over potential health aid cuts by the US government, warning of increased deaths. Elon Musk responded sharply, suggesting Gates' unhappiness stemmed from his organization losing US taxpayer funding. This exchange is the latest in a series of disagreements, fueled by Gates' past short position against Tesla stock, which reportedly cost him $1.5 billion.

title: Rishi Sunak: A journey from banker to Prime Minister to a job at Goldman Sachs
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is returning to Goldman Sachs as a senior advisor, marking a full circle in his career. After serving as Prime Minister during a turbulent period, Sunak will now advise on macroeconomic and geopolitical issues. Notably, his earnings will be donated to the Richmond Project, a charity he co-founded.

title: Watch: Rescue teams try to pull out truck after Gujarat bridge collapse; 10 dead, several injured
content: In Gujarat's Vadodara district, a section of the Gambhira Bridge collapsed, causing a truck, van, and car to fall into the Mahisagar River. Rescue teams are working at the site, with ten fatalities confirmed and nine individuals hospitalised with injuries. Prime Minister Modi has offered condolences and announced financial assistance for the victims' families.

title: US Air Force halts SpaceX project; Reason same as why Elon Musk skipped omelette …
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: Rajasthan: IAF fighter jet crashes in Churu; both pilots dead
content: An Indian Air Force Jaguar fighter jet crashed in Rajasthan's Churu district on Wednesday, prompting immediate search and rescue operations. The incident occurred near Ratangarh town, as confirmed by defence sources. This marks the second Jaguar crash within three months, following a similar incident in April near Jamnagar, Gujarat, where one pilot died despite ejection attempts.

title: 'England have got plans': Ben Stokes on stopping Shubman Gill
content: Shubman Gill's incredible form, highlighted by twin centuries in the second Test, propelled India to a dominant victory over England, leveling the series 1-1. As Gill aims to continue his stellar run at Lord's, England captain Ben Stokes acknowledges the challenge and reveals Jofra Archer's return to the playing XI, hoping his presence will shift the momentum.

title: Virat Kohli, and Avneet Kaur at the same Wimbledon match
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen at Wimbledon 2025, watching Novak Djokovic defeat Alex de Minaur. Actress Avneet Kaur also attended, sparking online buzz due to a recent social media incident involving Kohli. Kohli addressed the speculation, clarifying it was an algorithmic error, while Djokovic advanced to the quarterfinals.

title: Travis Kelce picks Super Bowl over wedding plans with Taylor Swift
content: Travis Kelce prioritizes winning another Super Bowl over wedding plans with Taylor Swift, driven by the Chiefs' Super Bowl LIX loss and a statistically disappointing 2024 season. Kelce aims to end his potential final NFL season with a fourth ring, focusing on regaining top form to support Patrick Mahomes and silence critics.

title: NHL trade rumors: Connor McDavid might have the Toronto Maple Leafs waiting for him
content: Following the Edmonton Oilers' Stanley Cup Finals defeat, speculations swirl around Connor McDavid's future. Reports suggest a potential move to the Toronto Maple Leafs when his contract ends, uniting Canada's best player with its biggest hockey market. While McDavid remains silent, focusing on family, fans hope for an Oilers resurgence next season.

title: Ex-NHL enforcer Nick Tarnasky floors drunken man in wild golf-course brawl
content: A recent viral video shows former NHL enforcer Nick Tarnasky physically confronting a drunk man during a heated altercation at a Canadian golf course. After repeated warnings, Tarnasky throws the man into a lake and lands a series of punches when the aggressor returns for more. The incident has sparked widespread attention online.

title: Donald Trump’s fresh tariff warning: 50% on copper, 200% on pharmaceuticals
content: US President Donald Trump is considering significant tariffs, potentially 200% on pharmaceuticals and 50% on copper imports, expanding his trade policies. These measures aim to boost US revenue. India is assessing the impact, with concerns about disrupted exports.

title: ‘Had to answer in my own style’: Sena MLA defends thrashing canteen worker
content: Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad is under scrutiny after allegedly assaulting canteen staff at the Akashwani MLA hostel in Colaba due to being served substandard food. Gaikwad claimed the dal and rice were rotten, leading to his violent outburst, captured in a viral video. This incident adds to Gaikwad's history of controversial behavior and inflammatory remarks.

title: 'Doesn't send right message': Fadnavis slams Sena MLA's 'inappropriate' behaviour
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has denounced Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad for assaulting canteen workers at the Akashwani MLA hostel in Mumbai. Fadnavis said that such behaviour sends the wrong message, after a video went viral showing Gaikwad slapping and punching an employee. Gaikwad alleges he was served stale food and that repeated complaints about the canteen's poor quality, including claims of rodents and unsanitary conditions, were ignored.

title: Niti Aayog’s gaffe: Mamata writes to vice chairman for confusing Bengal's map with Bihar's
content: West Bengal's Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticized Niti Aayog for using Bihar's map in a report meant for West Bengal. She termed the error as an insult to the state's identity and questioned the institution's credibility. Banerjee demanded an official apology and immediate correction, highlighting concerns about the reliability of Niti Aayog's work.

title: Earth’s fastest spin: July 9 to be one of shortest days
content: Earth is spinning faster, making July 9, 2025, one of the shortest day since 1960 by 1.3 to 1.6 milliseconds, primarily due to the Moon's alignment. While imperceptible in daily life, this speedup may necessitate a negative leap second in 2029 if the trend continues. Scientists are closely monitoring these changes to refine climate models and satellite navigation.

title: Epstein Files: Why MAGA feels betrayed by Trump
content: Earlier, when President Donald Trump snapped at a reporter, “Are you still talking about Jeffrey Epstein?”, it was a reminder that conspiracy theories may comfort the masses, but they discomfort those in power. Especially when those same theories were once fuel for their rise.

title: Daniel Serafini murder trial; prosecutors expose affair & motive in deadly shooting
content: The Daniel Serafini murder trial in Placer County concluded this Tuesday. Serafini is accused of killing his in-laws in 2021. The prosecution presented evidence including cell phone records and witness testimony. The defense argued lack of direct evidence and questioned witness credibility. The jury, consisting of ten women and two men, now deliberates.

title: Laid & lost: New road vanishes in rain days before inauguration in Rajasthan
content: Heavy rain caused the Katli river to swell in Jhunjhunu district. A newly constructed road connecting Baghwali-Jahaj to NH 52 was washed away. This collapse disconnected Papra and Panchlagi villages. Locals allege substandard materials were used. They demand a high-level investigation and action against those responsible. Villagers insist on expert supervision for future construction to prevent recurrence.

title: European rights court says Moscow broke international law; violated Ukraine, downed flight MH17
content: The European Court of Human Rights held Russia accountable for the MH17 tragedy and rights abuses in Ukraine. The court addressed cases filed by Ukraine and Netherlands related to Moscow's actions since 2014. Despite Russia's expulsion from the Council of Europe, the court asserted its jurisdiction. Volodymyr Zelenskyy has approved plans for a new international court.

title: Countries with best work-life balance: US misses top 10; how did India score?
content: The 2025 Global Life-Work Balance Index reveals that smaller economies often outperform larger ones in supporting employee well-being. New Zealand leads the ranking, excelling in paid leave, healthcare, and safety. The US lags significantly due to limited leave policies and inclusivity, while India faces challenges in healthcare and work-life balance.

title: 'Millions of Abdul Raufs': Ex-Pakistan FM downplays LeT terrorist's funeral photo
content: Former Pakistani foreign minister Hina Rabbani Khar faced scrutiny defending a man identified as LeT leader Hafiz Abdul Rauf, who led funeral prayers for terrorists killed in India's Operation Sindoor. Khar denied his identity, but the interviewer pointed out a matching US Treasury-listed ID number. Khar then claimed the Pakistani army wasn't defending a US-proscribed individual.

title: Erin Andrews, Charissa Thompson ink new Fox extensions, squash exit chatter
content: Erin Andrews and Charissa Thompson are staying with FOX Sports. The network extended their contracts before the 2025 NFL season. Andrews will report with Kevin Burkhardt and Tom Brady. Thompson continues on Fox NFL Kickoff. This move provides stability after Jimmy Johnson's departure. Their podcast, 'Calm Down,' adds to their appeal. FOX secures its NFL coverage with this decision.

title: IND vs ENG: Archer returns after four years, England reveal playing XI
content: Jofra Archer is set to return to England's Test team after a four-year absence, replacing Joshua Tongue for the Lord's Test. Despite concerns about his fitness following a single first-class match, Archer's inclusion is driven by his potential impact. Michael Vaughan cautions against expecting too much too soon from Archer, highlighting the need to manage his return carefully.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Akash Deep got England squad inclusion news while at hospital with cancer-stricken sister
content: Akash Deep dedicated India's Edgbaston Test victory to his sister, who is battling cancer. Despite his family crisis, he claimed 10 wickets, the best by an Indian bowler in England. His U-19 coach, Saurasish Lahiri, revealed Akash's silent struggles and commitment to his sister's care, even during his India selection for the five-match series.

title: Bridge collapse: 10 killed after several vehicles plunge into river; PM condoles loss of lives
content: A tragic bridge collapse on the Gambhira Bridge in Gujarat's Vadodara district resulted in ten fatalities and six injuries. The incident, affecting the Padra–Mujpur stretch, involved multiple vehicles plunging into the Mahisagar River. Rescue operations are underway, with local authorities and disaster response units at the scene.

title: Shubman Gill creates history with career-best Test ranking
content: Shubman Gill's stellar Test performances have propelled him to a career-best sixth position in the ICC rankings, while Harry Brook reclaims the top spot, surpassing Joe Root. Several players, including Ravindra Jadeja and Jamie Smith, have also made significant gains after the Edgbaston Test. In ODIs, Charith Asalanka and Kusal Mendis shine, with Wanindu Hasaranga surging in bowling rankings.

title: Missing Mumbai doctor jumps off Atal Setu; no suicide note found; search on for body
content: A 32-year-old doctor, Dr. Omkar Kavitake, associated with JJ Hospital, Mumbai, is feared drowned after reportedly jumping off the Atal Setu bridge on Monday night. Authorities were alerted by a motorist and CCTV footage confirmed the incident. Police located Dr. Kavitake's car and belongings, initiating a search operation. Despite ongoing efforts involving marine units and local vigilance, Dr.

title: 728 drones, 13 missiles: Russia unleashes record attack on Ukraine
content: Ukraine has accused Russia of launching its largest barrage of missiles and drones in over three years, surpassing last week's record. Ukrainian air defenses claim to have intercepted most of the drones and some missiles. This attack follows President Trump's announcement of increased weapon deliveries to Ukraine and accusations against Putin.

title: Olympic icon Mary Lou Retton gasps for oxygen as DUI video and mugshot spark outrage
content: A video showing former Olympic gymnast Mary Lou Retton struggling through a field sobriety test after her May 2025 DUI arrest in West Virginia has surfaced, shocking fans. The footage reveals Retton, 57, appearing distressed and out of breath, claiming she needed oxygen due to her past battle with pneumonia.

title: Trump Gold Card: Indians from these fields show big interest; what happens to EB-5?
content: Donald Trump's proposed $5 million Gold Card visa program is generating significant buzz among Indian professionals, particularly those in the tech, finance, and healthcare sectors. Despite the lack of official launch and legislative support, the initiative has attracted considerable interest.

title: ‘Will keep safe distance from Earth’: Nasa spots rare comet; shares picture
content: NASA's ATLAS telescope in Chile has detected a fast-moving interstellar comet, named 3I/Atlas, currently located 4.5 au from the Sun. This is only the third alien object observed in our solar system, following Oumuamua and comet 2I/Borisov. 3I/Atlas poses no threat to Earth and will approach the Sun around October 30, passing between Mars and Earth.

title: Gabrielle Union beams as Dwyane Wade hugs her and Kaavia in sweet family moment
content: Gabrielle Union shared a heartwarming Instagram story featuring Dwyane Wade and their daughter Kaavia by a bonfire during a vacation. The image captured a tender family moment, with Wade holding Kaavia and gently touching Gabrielle. This simple yet powerful display of love and connection resonated with fans, highlighting the couple's enduring bond and commitment to family.

title: Bharat Bandh: Trade unions stage nationwide strike; why are they protesting and what they're demanding
content: Ten central trade unions initiated a nationwide strike, Bharat Bandh, impacting banking, postal services, electricity, mining, and public transport across India. The unions, backed by agricultural organizations, protest against the government's labor and economic policies, claiming they favor corporate interests.

title: 26/11 attack probe: Plotter Tahawwur Rana's judicial custody extended
content: A Delhi court has extended the judicial custody of Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, until August 13. Rana, extradited from the US in April, is an associate of David Headley, a main conspirator in the attacks. The attacks, executed by Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists, resulted in 166 fatalities and shook India's financial capital.

title: RJD's Manoj Jha accuses EC of backing out of scheduled meet; poll body responds
content: The Election Commission (EC) refuted RJD MP Manoj Jha's allegations regarding a cancelled meeting concerning Bihar's electoral roll revision. The EC clarified that Jha's authorization was limited and no communication was received from key RJD leaders.

title: UAE Golden Visa: Has a Rs 23 lakh special visa been launched? Officials respond
content: Reports of a new UAE golden visa pilot program, particularly for Indian nationals with a lifetime visa for AED 100,000, have been dismissed by UAE authorities. The ICP clarified that Golden Visa requirements are explicitly outlined in official regulations, accessible through their digital platforms.

title: NDA government in Andhra Pradesh has pushed farmers into a debt trap, rendered them bankrupt, alleges YSRCP chief Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: No crop is getting MSP in the State, and with the government in a deep slumber, I will directly lead the fight to ensure justice to the farmers, says Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Malayalam film ‘Moonwalk’ has put the spotlight back on Footloosers, Thiruvananthapuram’s pioneering breakdance academy
content: As Moonwalk celebrates the breakdance community, Santosh Kumar a.k.a Babu Footloosers and brother Sajeesh Kumar talk about their rise to stardom and how they adapted to changing times

title: BJP accuses LDF of maliciously attempting to link Muraleedharan to suspected ‘Pakistani spy’ Jyoti Malhotra
content: The YouTuber had interviewed the former Union Minister impromptu during the maiden journey of Vande Bharat train in Kerala, and was not a Railways guest. Other leaders were also present

title: Opposition parties promoted 'one district, one mafia' policy in Uttar Pradesh: CM Adityanath
content: Addressing an event Gorakhpur, Yogi Adityanath questioned the critics of his government's tree plantation drive

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Efforts on to save Nimisha Priya death row, says key negotiator in Yemen
content: Samuel Jerome Bhaskaran, an aviation consultant, who has been based in Yemen since 1999, has been coordinating the efforts to save her from execution.  A nurse from Kerala, Nimisha Priya has been imprisoned in Sanaa’s central jail since 2017, convicted of murdering Yemeni national Talal Abdo Mahdi, her business partner

title: YSRCP chief Jagan Mohan Reddy’s visit to Bangarupalem turns into a political roadshow
content: With party cadres pouring in from Chittoor, Annamayya, and Tirupati districts, the YSRCP president’s visit to the market yard, purportedly to interact with the mango farmers, triggers unruly scenes, mob frenzy, and altercation with the police, besides paralysing traffic on the Chittoor-Bengaluru National Highway

title: Bulldozer clears illegal encroachments along Kanwar route in Sambhal
content: To facilitate an obstruction-free journey for Kanwar pilgrims, the encroachments narrowing the path are being cleared by the tehsil administration, says Sub-Divisional Magistrate Vikas Chandra

title: PM Modi holds talks with Namibia President Nandi-Ndaitwah
content: After the talks, the two sides inked four agreements in a range of sectors, including health and medicine, biofuels and disaster resilience

title: Hyderabad | Cab driver arrested for attempt to murder constables on patrol duty in Bowenpally
content: While constable L. Praveen sustained a grievous fracture to his left leg, K. Chanti sustained minor injuries

title: Vice Chancellors of JNU will be referred to as Kulgurus, says Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav
content: Mohan Yadav did not clarify whether JNU has formally implemented this change or if an official administrative order has been issued

title: SEBI mulls allowing ratings agencies to rate instruments not regulated by it
content: Any agency that expands ratings to such instruments will need to set up a new unit within six months, SEBI said in a consultation paper

title: ED registers money laundering case in U.P. religious conversion racket
content: The agency has pressed various sections under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) to look into the possible generation of "proceeds of crime" by the accused

title: More than ₹80 lakh worth ganja seized in Andhra Pradesh’s Anakapalli
content: Though the seized ganja was procured for about ₹42 lakh in Odisha, it is estimated to be worth ₹80 lakh in some Northern States, as per the police

title: Scheduled Tribes panel denies info on Great Nicobar project, says disclosure would breach parliamentary privilege
content: The denial comes at a time when the Great Nicobar Island project has drawn sharp criticism from conservationists, scientists and tribal rights advocates, who fear that it could displace Indigenous communities and irreversibly damage ecologically sensitive zones

title: 12 Maoists, including 9 carrying ₹28.50 lakh bounty, surrender in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada
content: In 2024, a total of 792 Maoists had surrendered in Bastar region, comprising seven districts, including Dantewada, as per police

title: Over 13,000 engineering seats added for counselling in Tamil Nadu this year
content: This increase has by and large been bolstered by the high demand for Computer Science-related courses, which accounted for an increase of close to 10,000 seats in the current academic year

title: Maharashtra Medical Council’s modern medicine practice permission to homeopaths draws IMA’s ire
content: The MMC notification, dated June 30, authorises the initiation of a Certificate Course in Modern Pharmacology for homeopathy practitioners, enabling them to practice modern medicine; the Indian Medical Association has demanded a rollback of this permission

title: HYDRAA clears encroachment in Hyderguda layout open space
content: A team of Engineers from the Lakes department of Bengaluru visited the lake development works by HYDRAA

title: Kerala govt to challenge HC order cancelling KEAM results; Minister says students won’t be affected
content: R. Bindu points out that normalisation method introduced this year was based on feedback and complaints raised in previous years, particularly from Kerala State Board students

title: Musk's Starlink receives India's final regulatory nod for launch, sources say
content: Starlink will now need to secure spectrum from the government, set up ground infrastructure, and demonstrate through testing and trials that it meets the security rules it has signed up for

title: Hyderabad to witness Gallery G’s travelling exhibition, featuring artworks of Indian masters
content: Bengaluru-based Gallery G to showcase its travelling exhibition, On The Go, in Hyderabad this weekend. Alongside works of VS Gaitonde, Surya Prakash and Manu Parekh, look out for a silver filigree heritage furniture set

title: Aviation safety in focus at parliamentary panel meeting
content: Sources said there was concern among some members over a large number of vacancies in the aviation regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation, while a few others spoke about the agency not implementing several of the earlier recommendations of the committee

title: Meghalaya High Court reinstates four dismissed NECTAR scientists
content: Meghalaya High Court ordered full restoration of their jobs along with back pay, allowances, and service benefits in a judgment issued on July 8

title: Kochi BPCL fire: 23 families trapped between two major industrial units face daily peril
content: Left to suffer air, noise, and water pollution, the incident in which many residents were left dizzy and nauseated by thick fumes and pungent odour after KSEB’s underground 220kV cables from Brahmapuram substation went up in flames was just the latest chapter in their ongoing plight

title: Women SHG members in Sangareddy to get loans for Indiramma Houses construction
content: Several beneficiaries, from poor and underprivileged backgrounds, struggled to gather finances at initial or other stages of construction

title: It sends out wrong message that legislators misuse power: CM Fadnavis on Sena MLA slapping canteen worker
content: The State Chief Minister condemns Shiv Sena MLA’s action and said it impacts the image of the state legislature and as an MLA

title: FATF comments on state financing of terror reinforces India’s position on Pakistan: sources
content: ⁠The FATF report also highlights the funding patterns of Pakistan-based LeT (Lashkar-e-Taiba) and JeM (Jaish-e-Mohammed)

title: Bharat Bandh: No impact on industrial production in Mysuru, but strike highlights four labour codes formulated by Centre
content: One of the key demands put forward by the trade unions was abrogation of the four labour codes formulated by the Centre

title: IAF jet crash: Two pilots killed after Jaguar fighter jet crashes near Churu in Rajasthan; third such incident this year
content: The Indian Air Force said a court of inquiry has been constituted to ascertain the cause of the accident

title: YSRCP slams TDP-led govt. for curbing Jagan’s Chittoor visit
content: YSRCP leaders alleged that the government was resorting to undemocratic measures to curb Jagan’s public outreach in Bangarupalem where he was scheduled to meet mango farmers.

title: Madras High Court directs Centre to take down woman advocate’s private images, videos from internet within 48 hours
content: ‘What if she had been my daughter’: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh turns emotional during the hearing of the case and praises her for fighting the stereotypes in society

title: Nara Bhuvaneswari condemns derogatory remarks against Kovvur MLA Prashanthi Reddy
content: In a statement on X, Nara Bhuvaneswari expressed unwavering solidarity with the MLA, asserting that such language has no place in a civilised society

title: SFI to boycott classes on July 10 protesting against Kerala Governor
content: SFI to march to Central government offices against Arlekar’s attempt to ‘undermine autonomy of public-funded universities in the State’

title: A.P. govt. urged to scrap the EPC model in irrigation contracts
content: ‘Scrap the corrupt EPC model that’s draining public funds,’ says Andhra Pradesh Samagra Adhyayana Vedika convener T. Lakshminarayana

title: Delhi court extends Mumbai terror attack accused Tahawwur Rana's judicial custody till August 13
content: Tahawwur Rana was brought to India after the U.S. Supreme Court on April 4 dismissed his review plea against his extradition to India

title: Kerala High Court quashes KEAM 2025 entrance exam results
content: Justice D.K. Singh states that revised method in KEAM 2025 to calculate ranks adversely affects students who studied CBSE or ICSE syllabus

title: Vande Bharat halted near Dindigul after mist from fire extinguisher mistaken for smoke
content: Railway official clarifies that some passenger had inadvertently opened the aerosol fire extinguisher installed in the restroom, leading to the release of “mist” inside the coach

title: Architecture University issue: Nara Lokesh accuses Jagan Mohan Reddy of jeopardising future of students
content: Taking to X, Nara Lokesh wrote, “You committed the blunders, and now you’re trying to curse us for fixing them?”

title: Telangana | Nationwide strike hits coal mining operations in SCCL; demonstrators demand repeal of Centre’s four labour codes
content: The one-day strike is expected to cause a revenue loss of around ₹76 crore to the coal mining company, SCCL sources said

title: Kerala Water Transport department to launch Kuttanad Safari boat tour in Alappuzha
content: Kuttanad Safari to be modelled after popular desert safaris in Gulf countries, says Transport Minister

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy condemns attack on former MLA Prasanna Kumar; blames TDP for orchestrating violence
content: Mr. Jagan said the TDP regime has become synonymous with lawlessness, citing that it has led to three murders, six attempted murders and twelve assaults in a short span

title: Udaipur Files: ‘Let the film be released,’ says Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court refused to urgently list a plea challenging the screening of the film ‘Udaipur Files: Kanhaiya Lal tailor murder’

title: Flash flood hits Tripura: More than 100 families rendered homeless
content: All schools and anganwadi centres in the district will remain closed during the day as a precautionary measure

title: ED conducts searches across Punjab and Haryana in “donkey route” case
content: The searches were carried out in Punjab’s Amritsar, Sangrur, Patiala, and Moga; and Ambala, Kurukshetra, and Karnal in Haryana, as part of the probe into money-laundering angle

title: T.N. CM Stalin pays tributes to Raja of Panagal on his birth anniversary
content: “While we now assert with pride that reservation is our right, it was a century ago that this visionary of social justice laid the path through the Communal G.O.,” Mr. Stalin said in a post on X

title: Secunderabad Cantonment | ₹128 crore underground drainage to be constructed with Defence Ministry funds
content: Besides more parks, laying internal roads and other works, efforts would also be made to construct two-bedroom housing for the poor with a proper integrated plan

title: Supreme Court takes suo motu case on ED summons to lawyers for their legal opinions to clients
content: The apex court bar associations had earlier written to Chief Justice Gavai on the ‘chilling effect’ the summons had on the independence of the legal profession, and eventually the entire justice administration process

title: Opposition stages protest in Patna against electoral roll revision
content: Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav allege disenfranchisement through Special Intensive Revision; BJP calls protest a “flop show”

title: Four children drown in water-filled pit in Uttar Pradesh’s Bedauli village
content: Vaishnavi, Hunar, Kanha, and Khesari went missing while playing outside their homes and were found dead in a water-filled pit in a nearby field

title: Delhi-bound IndiGo flight returns to Patna after takeoff due to technical snag, all onboard safe
content: The flight will undergo inspection; airlines will make alternate arrangements for the passengers to send them to their destination

title: 19 admitted to Hyderabad hospitals after consuming adulterated toddy, 78-year-old critical
content: Officials from the Prohibition and Excise Department have since sealed three toddy outlets located in Hyderanagar, Shamshiguda and KPHB Colony

title: Normal life partially affected as Left supporters try to enforce trade union strike in WB; clash with police
content: CPI(M) supporters tried to block roads and railways across several districts of West Bengal and in Kolkata. The situation turned volatile at Jadavpur, Ganguly Bagan at College Street areas.

title: Bharat Bandh: Almost no impact in Bengaluru
content: The Bengaluru Traffic Police (BTP) had issued an advisory as thousands of protesters were expected to gather near Freedom Park in the morning

title: Madras High Court may modify order preventing TNSTC buses from crossing four toll plazas in south Tamil Nadu
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh accepts a request made by Additional Advocate General J. Ravindran to take up the matter on Thursday morning

title: Bharat bandh: National strike assumes proportions of a bandh in Kerala
content: Lockdown of services almost halts private and public stage carriage and long-distance services, inconveniencing hundreds of passengers

title:
Namibia a ‘valued and trusted partner’ in Africa: PM Modi
as he arrives in Namibia
content: This is the first visit of Prime Minister Modi to Namibia and the third ever Prime Ministerial visit from India to the country

title: Karnataka Health Department sets targets and timelines for hospitals to implement National Quality Assurance Standards
content: The NQAS is a comprehensive framework developed by the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare to improve the quality of healthcare services in public health facilities

title: Four vehicles fall into river as bridge collapses in Vadodara; at least ten killed
content: Rescue teams managed to pull out six persons alive, while search operations continue for those missing

title: Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad slaps canteen staff in Mumbai over stale food
content: In the video, Mr. Gaikwad is seen berating the canteen operator, refusing to pay the bill, and slapping the staff member seated at the billing counter

title: Fresh batch of over 7,500 pilgrims leaves for Amarnath shrine
content: The number of pilgrims who have paid obeisance at the cave shrine in Amarnath has crossed one lakh as on July 9, 2025.

title: NWKRTC job aspirants allege higher recruitment in areas other than north Karnataka
content: They have taken exception to filling only 1,000 posts instead of the 2,814 posts notified by NWKRTC for recruitment

title: Kerala man facing attachment of house due to loan default found hanging
content: He reportedly took a housing loan for around ₹21 lakh more than a decade ago. The liability soared to around ₹38 lakh following default

title: Import-export fraud case accused extradited from U.S. after over two decades
content: Monika Kapoor, as the proprietor of Monika Overseas, allegedly conspired with her brothers, Rajan Khanna and Rajiv Khanna, to forge export documents to get replenishment licences for import of duty-free gold

title: Trump prevented war between India, Pakistan: U.S. Secretary of State Rubio
content: Trump again repeated the claim that he stopped the war between India and Pakistan by telling the two neighbours that Washington will not do trade with them if they continued the fighting

title: Bharat Bandh: Normal life hit in Kerala’s Ernakulam district
content: Shops and commercial establishments remained closed in the district. Public transport was also affected as private buses stayed off the roads. No untoward incidents were reported so far

title: Six members of radical Manipur outfit arrested for assaulting police officer
content: In a series of crackdowns on July 8, the State police also caught four members of the extremist Kangleipak Communist Party (People’s War Group)

title: Karnataka rains: Ballari officials told to be prepared for possible floods as water level rises in Tungabhadra river
content: Instructs tahsildars of flood-prone areas, especially in Kampli and Siruguppa taluks, to initiate precautionary measures, including relocation of vulnerable populations to safer locations

title: Bizarre choices for Nobel Peace Prize made in past century: Congress after Pakistan, Israel nominate Trump
content: In a different era, two prominent Indians— Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru had been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize, Congress said

title: Staying at home during COVID-19 to be treated as duty for trainees: Rail Ministry
content: The ministry's circular came after one of the Zonal Railways unit sought to know whether the period spent at home during nationwide lockdown due to pandemic be considered as duty also for the purpose of increments.

title: Harassing juniors through informal WhatsApp groups to be treated as ragging: UGC
content: Forcing students to cut their hair, stay awake for long hours or verbally humiliating them were cited as other common ragging practices

title: Spain PM Announces Anti-Graft Plan As Scandal Rocks Government
content: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Wednesday announced an anti-corruption plan designed with the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development in a bid to salvage confidence in his scandal-hit government.

title: 11 Killed After Bridge Collapses In Gujarat: A Look Back At Major Tragedies
content: 11 people were killed and three others injured on Wednesday morning when a portion of the Gambhira-Mujpur bridge collapsed in Gujarat's Vadodara district, sending multiple vehicles into the Mahisagar (Mahi) River.

title: 11 Killed After Vehicles Fall Into River As Bridge Collapses In Gujarat
content: 11 people were killed and several vehicles fell into the Mahisagar (Mahi) River after a section of the Gambhira-Mujpur bridge in Padra taluka of Gujarat's Vadodara collapsed on Wednesday.

title: 106 Crores In 40 Accounts: Conversion Gang Mastermind Chhangur Baba's Empire
content: Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba - the mastermind of a religious conversion gang - once used to sell rings and amulets on his bicycle.

title: Gujarat Bridge That Fell Shook When Cars Crossed, Was Disaster-In-Waiting
content: Fisherman Narendra Mali was at work this morning at the Mahisagar river, close to the Gambhira bridge that connects Gujarat's Vadodara and Anand districts. He was looking for the day's catch when he and his companions heard noises

title: PM Modi Conferred With Namibia's Highest Civilian Award During First Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Wednesday conferred with Namibia's highest civilian award, 'Order of the Most Ancient Welwitschia Mirabilis'.

title: Shashi Tharoor Shares Survey In Which He Tops Kerala Chief Minister Poll
content: Amid an uneasy equation with the Congress high command, senior leader and Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor appears to have received a significant boost from a pre-poll survey conducted by Mumbai-based VoteVibe.

title: Ukraine Says Russia Launched Largest Drone, Missile Attack Since War Began
content: Russia pummelled Ukraine with its largest missile and drone attack in more than three years of war, claiming to have targeted an airfield in a region bordering EU and NATO member Poland.

title: Watch: Train In Jharkhand Stops For 2 Hours To Let Elephant Deliver Calf
content: A train in Jharkhand stopped for two hours, waiting for an Elephant to deliver her calf near the railway track, an act that symbolised "harmonious" co-existence of humans and animals.

title: "Public Prefers Notes Over...": Centre To Court Over Plans To Issue Rs 50 Coins
content: The Central government informed the Delhi High Court it has no plans to introduce Rs 50 coins at present citing public preference for using banknotes over coins, especially for Rs 10 and Rs 20 denominations.

title: 'Cocaine In Sandal Heels': Sophisticated Drug Network Dismantled In Hyderabad
content: In a major crackdown on narcotics that has sent shockwaves through Hyderabad, the Elite Action Group for Drug Law Enforcement (EAGLE) has dismantled a highly sophisticated, transnational drug trafficking network operating in the city.

title: 3 Men Allegedly Rape Woman In Bengaluru, Steal Her Fridge, Washing Machine
content: A woman from Bengaluru has alleged that she was raped by her friend and two other men, who then threatened her and made her transfer money to them before snatching her phone and even stealing her fridge and washing machine.

title: Adani Enterprises Limited's Rs 1,000 Crore NCD Issue Fully Subscribed In 3 Hours
content: Adani Enterprises Limited's (AEL) second public issuance of secured, rated and listed redeemable, non-convertible debentures (NCD) worth Rs 1,000 crore was fully subscribed within three hours of opening on Wednesday.

title: Natural Farming, Reading Hindu Scriptures: Amit Shah On "Retirement Plan"
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that he will take up natural farming after retiring from public life and devote a considerable amount of time to reading Hindu scriptures, including the Vedas and Upanishads.

title: Madhya Pradesh Teen Dies Days After Stray Dog Bite, Despite Getting Shots
content: In Madhya Pradesh, a growing wave of stray dog attacks is claiming lives, injuring children, and spreading fear across urban and rural areas alike.

title: Video: Pappu Yadav, Kanhaiya Kumar Stopped From Boarding Van With Rahul Gandhi
content: In a potential embarrassment for the Congress, its leader Kanhaiya Kumar and Purnia MP Pappu Yadav were stopped from boarding an open van which had Rahul Gandhi, RJD Chief Tejashwi Yadav and some other leaders on it.

title: What Is MechaHitler? X's Grok Chatbot Praises Adolf Hitler In Deleted Posts
content: Grok, the AI chatbot developed by Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI, came under fire after a string of controversial and antisemitic posts on X. It also referred to itself as "MechaHitler" and praised Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler.

title: After 7-Year Wait, Women Supervisor Recruitment Now Nightmare For Aspirants
content: After a gap of seven years, the state government had issued a notification for the recruitment of 660 Women Supervisors. The announcement lit a spark of hope among six lakh candidates, many of whom had spent years preparing for government jobs.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'No More Double Standards': What India Really Meant At BRICS
content: Finally, after the debacle with the joint statement with the SCO just a few days ago, and with increasing domestic pressure regarding India's diplomatic outreach, the BRICS declaration strongly condemned the gruesome Pahalgam attacks.

title: Girls Told To Strip For Period Check After Blood Stains Found In School Bathroom
content: Girls in a Maharashtra school, between classes 5-10, were forced to strip and examined by teachers after blood stains were found in the bathroom, sparking anger among parents, said the police.

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: 'Am going to bomb Moscow, Beijing': Trump's old warning to Putin, Xi - audio viral
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: João Pedro arrives in style, fires Chelsea into final
content: Joo Pedro earns back a huge slice of his £55 million transfer fee against former club Fluminense . the 23-year-old scored twice to help his new club book a place in the final against either real madrid or Paris Saint-Germain . liam delap's side ended the tournament as Brazil's most successful side .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Divisional rankings: Which fighter replaces Catterall?
content: welterweight boxer Jack Catterall won his debut by technical decision over Harlem Eubank . a cut caused by a clash of heads ended the fight prematurely . his departure from 140 pounds makes room for dalton Smith to enter the rankings at No. 10 .

title: 'Gift of this new little life': Tim Tebow and wife Demi-Leigh welcome newborn daughter
content: daphne Reign Tebow's middle name is inspired by a young girl they admire . "we couldn't be more grateful for the blessing and gift of this new little life," he wrote . the couple announced the birth of their daughter in a joint Instagram post .

title: 'Tough love' coaching style prompts abuse concerns on Stanford's water polo team
content: the battle over Flacks' coaching style centers on what constitutes "tough love" versus "toxic" behavior . one faction blames the controversy on parental interference, players' dissatisfaction over playing time and an inability to cope with the rigors of collegiate play .

title: Areas of concern: What could trip up each of our Top 25 teams
content: Penn State has only one wide receiver rank among the top 10 in the Big Ten in receiving in the past three seasons . the rosiest picture has some lurking shadows for each of the top 25 teams in our post-spring Power Rankings .

title: Final 2025 MLB draft rankings: Which college ace is No. 1 in our top 250 prospects?
content: I've updated my overall minor league top 100 rankings to make adjustments and remove graduated players so you can see roughly where the top players in the draft would slot on that list . this year's class is highlighted by a group of college left-handed pitchers near the top of the rankings .
